channel.title: Writing an ISO without a program?
channel.description:
Is it possible? I'm on my only computer with a CD writing drive and its a limited account (sad, I know) and I need to write an ISO to a CD but I can't find any programs I can do it with. Is there a way I can do it without downloading anything of Rebooting in safe mode, go into my admin accoutn, change acc type, etc. or any hacks?
EDIT: I think I'm going to try and put an old CD ROM drive that I have on my other computer and just use Nero to burn it. Still if anyone knows how to do what I just posted, I would really like to know.

item.title: Writing an ISO without a program?
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

I get this:

D:\Documents and Settings\Administrator>control userpasswords2
'control' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.

It could be because I fhked up my environmental variables or what ever there called.

EDIT: Never mind, Javacisnotrecognized helped. And this worked too! Thanks a bunch, Kubuntu here I come![br][size=1]Posted on: April 24, 2007, 09:00:45 AM[/size][hr]You have to be an admin to access that feature… Damnit.

Read full topic
item.source: Writing an ISO without a program?

item.title: Writing an ISO without a program?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Go to start, all programs, accessorys, go to command prompt and type “control userpasswords2” and give yourself a temp admin account, as windows can’t burn ISO’s nativly.

Read full topic
